commentBody:
As a male, I feel ashamed watching this video. Guilty by association, I guess. I weep with the men who were asked to read a litany of vitriolic texts, tweets and emails sent to these -- no, all -- women. I ask myself, "How can I be part of the solution?"

Kudos to all those who understand this isn't only about sports or journalism. It's much, much bigger. It's about homes, boardrooms, assembly lines, schools, everywhere.

What's more, its impact reaches far beyond the individual victims. As an educator and a parent I draw a direct line from the faceless hate speech of "adult" text assassins to the epidemic of cyber bullying among children and adolescents. Our efforts at protecting our kids from this scourge clearly need to go hand-in-hand with a broader campaign of education and prevention. If not now, when?
